headline: King Charles
subHeadline: Alabama Supreme Court Ruling That Frozen Embryos Are Children; Many Republicans Wants To Protect IVF; Trump Says His Indictments Appeal To Black Voters; Jon Meacham On Biden-Trump Rematch; Mitch McConnell To Step Down From GOP Leadership Position In The Senate; Sloan Dulce On Jon Stewart's Return; Rex Chapman's Struggles With Addiction And His Powerful Story Of Redemption. Aired 8-9p ET

utterances.speaker: CHARLES BARKLEY, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Hey, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: GAYLE KING, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Hey, Mr. Barkley. You know what, I was thinking -- hello. Yes, it's Charles Barkley.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Stop, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Everybody looks good when they're walking.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: From the CNN Studios in New York City, it's "King Charles."

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: We're not going to waste your time.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: With Gayle King --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I'm Beyonce but you could call me Gayle.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: -- and Charles Barkley.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's cold as -- out here.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Tonight, best-selling presidential historian Jon Meacham, former NBA star Rex Chapman, and from "The Daily Show," comedian Dulce Sloan. "King Charles" starts now.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Going in, going in. Welcome, welcome.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Every time I see that open, Charles, I always say I'm glad we get to do this show, don't you?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I love doing this show. But I am pumped tonight. I know we got a couple of special guests, but I'm really excited for Rex Chapman. I love that guy. KING

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I just met him. You've known him for a long time.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You were so excited, you called me. Don't be calling me on the weekend, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We got a real special show for you tonight, because we've got three interviews that we can't wait to talk to you about. In a few minutes, we're going to bring in a presidential story and a man with a hand in the State of the Union address that's coming up very soon. His name is Jon Meacham.Then we have one of stars of "The Daily Show," that would be Dulce Sloan, to talk about what's going on in this country. Some people are very concerned. We were out talking to people earlier this evening, they're very concerned about what's happening in America. How she's covering it? She's got a new book. She is talking about state of politics, dating. She has got lots to discuss. Plus, an interview. I know I'm very excited about this, Rex Chapman.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I didn't know Rex Chapman. He's on a journey. You have to see to believe from basketball star to addict to rock bottom to Twitter celebrity. Why do you like him? You've known him a while. Why do you like him?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I've known him a long time, number one, because he's just a great person. I really appreciate him sharing this book. And I had a younger brother who passed away who was an addict. So it's very personable -- personal to me.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: To you.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Somebody who makes it out the other side. And --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: How old was your brother?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I want to say 42, somewhere in there.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, a grown-up.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He was a grown-up.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But, man, most people, you know I got a chance to meet Jelly Roll at the All-Star Weekend. He had so many people who were covered on stage. And I walked up to him and said, man, thank you. Because it's interesting when you're in the fight.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Over it. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: To be honest with you.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because when we have somebody who's struggling with addiction, it ain't just them.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It's everybody around them.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's everybody around you.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, looking forward to talking to Rex.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And on our last show, just last Wednesday, just after the Alabama Supreme Court rule that frozen embryos used in fertility treatments were children. That story broke just as we were going on the air last week. We have Presidential Candidate Nikki Haley on and asked her about the ruling. She told us at that time that she believes -- you remember what she said.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: She's said -- Charles, she tells that life begins at conception. And so, yes, those frozen embryos, the ones thousands of desperate parents depend on to start or grow their families should be considered children.And then the House and the day since her comments on this show, her fellow Republicans have been desperately trying to change the conversation on the issue. Here's some of the conversations on this topic. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) DONALD TRUMP, FORMER U.S. PRESIDENT, U.S. PRESIDENTIAL REPUBLICAN CANDIDATE: I strongly support the availability of IVF for couples who are trying to have a precious little beautiful baby. REP. MATT GAETZ (R-FL): People who want to have family should have the government and the law on their side. SEN. ROGER MARSHALL (R-KS): I think the Dobbs decision clearly puts this issue back at the state level, and we would encourage the State Legislature of Alabama to right this wrong. SEN. LINDSEY GRAHAM (R-SC): In terms of fertility clinics, if you're pro-life you want these things to function, to actually provide people with children who have a hard time otherwise. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, even Alabama Senator -- that, of course, was Lindsey Graham, but Alabama Senator Tommy Tuberville is now saying IVF needs to be protected in the State of Alabama, which, Charles, is your state.Now, for the record, many of the Republicans are saying they want to protect IVF. They're also co-sponsors of a bill that's aimed at doing the opposite. Now dear, you're just sitting there with your head and your -- and your hands in your -- your head in your hands. Never a good sign. What's wrong?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What are you thinking?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: When I agree with Trump, Matt Gaetz, and Tommy Tuberville, you know things are bad. Like --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What do you agree with them on specifically, yes?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Anybody who wants to have a baby, who's trying, we should do everything to support them, make it economic feasible, and do everything in our power. Having a kid -- my daughter, I have one kid, she's the best thing ever happened to me in my life. And anybody who wants to have a baby, we should do everything in our power to give them the opportunity, make it affordable, and things like that.But, like I say, if I'm agreeing with Trump, Tuberville, and Gaetz, you know Alabama got it wrong.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Well, the problem in Alabama now is that many of the fertility clinics have put the procedures on hold, IVF.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, all of these parents that are in limbo, that for many of them, this is the only way that they could have a child. Just think about that for just a second. And I think many people struggle when you say that an embryo is a human, or is a child, because they don't have heartbeats, they are not fully formed, and I've heard woman after woman say to me, you know, I had four embryos implanted, none of them took.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Or I had two embryos implanted, only one of them took. So, there's no guarantee that the embryos will become children, that's why people are struggling.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, I understand that totally, but like, we should never criminalize -- well, first of all, I want to say something before I get started. I'm pro-choice. I want to make that clear. I'm pro- choice, but I disagree with the ruling for the simple fact, we should make it possible, and affordable. I know I'm being redundant, repeating myself, but it's just a bad ruling.And it's really unfortunate, not just in this situation, it's just really unfortunate how these politicians are taking away, so many women's reproductive rights.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's not up to me as a man. Even if I was in politics, it's not up to me to make the decision on whether women have babies or not. That's just -- that's not what our political system was about. The thing that bothers me the most, the politicians start using all these divisive issues as wedges to make -- to divide and conquer. I've always said that --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And it's working, though, Charles. Well, what we know is that the former president always makes news. We were texting about this over the weekend, Charles and I, when he says, please don't text me early in the morning. I can't help it.The former president raised a lot of eyebrows with these comments while talking to listen to the audience, a black conservative conference. He said this. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I got indicted a second time, and a third time, and a fourth time. And a lot of people said that that's why the black people like me, because they have been hurt so badly and discriminated against. And they actually viewed me as I'm being discriminated against.My -- the mug shot, we've all seen the mug shot. And you know who embraced it more than anybody else, the black population. It's incredible. You see black people walking around with my mug shot, you know, they do shirts. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: When you heard that, what did you think? Big sigh. Big sigh.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: First of all, I'm just going to say this. If I see a black person walking around with Trump mugs, I'm going to punch him in the face.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Charles --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I know, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Charles --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Gayle, Gayle, Gayle --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You really can't say that because, A, you don't mean that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, I mean that sincerely. I'm going to just tell you something --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And then you will be arrested for assault. And then, what?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm going to bail myself out and go celebrate. If I --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Don't encourage him. Don't encourage him. OK. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Seriously --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Continue.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: First of all, if I was at that at that --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: At that conference.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I would have got up and walked out. That was an insult to all black people. Well, he basically just saying -- and first of all, black -- to compare black history where we've been discriminated against to his plight --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, first of all, he's a billionaire. And they're prosecuting him for stuff he did wrong. They prosecuted him for stuff he did wrong. And for him to compare --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It's still in the court system, Charles. We have to wait. It's still in the court system. But continue, continue, continue.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, they -- some of the stuff is true. They did storm the capital. They did say that the election was stolen. Those aren't lies, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Those are facts.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: They did say that. They did say that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: OK. But to compare, I would have got up and walked out, because it's not a fair comparison. You know, he's a billionaire. He's had a great life. He's been president of the United States. To insult black people who have been discriminated against all these years, to put them in the same category, I was just offended.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I mean, I really was.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Well, some people question, A, if he is a billionaire, there's always conversation about that. But I think people thought --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: What do you think when you hear it?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's exactly right.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's what he meant.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He said something, but that's what he meant.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I do believe that. I do believe that's exactly what he meant. And then somebody tried to spin it to me and said, no, what he was saying is that he feels sympathetic to black people who have been falsely accused like he. I don't believe that that -- I do not believe that is what he was saying.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, let me -- listen, you know, I don't like to speak for all black people, but I'm going to right now.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: We don't feel sympathetic to his plight. We do not. We do -- and you know, Gayle --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You don't speak for all black people.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't like doing that, but I am in this particular case. We don't feel his plight. But I really just feel bad because we need adults in the room. You know, we got the immigrant problem. We got inflation. We got the situation in Hawaii. Like, I want to solve real problems. I don't want to talk about all this extracurricular stuff behind the scenes. I want somebody to get it and say, hey, you know what, I want to do what's great for the American people.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But you know what, Charles, while you say you don't speak for all black people, there is a contingent of people that say that the black vote -- that Donald Trump is getting more black vote this time than he did last time. I know you've heard that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, I think there's a couple of reasons. Number one, I don't like using the term black people, poor people. America's discriminate -- America -- number one, black people in this category, America discriminates against poor people, whether you're white or black. If you're poor, you discriminate. All these politicians --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It's more of a class issue, you say.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's 100 percent more of a class issue. That's what bothers me. But as a guy, I've only voted Republican one time of my life. I voted for John Kasich the president. I have voted Democratic my entire life. And I'm starting to question that. That don't mean I'm going to vote Republican, but I'm starting to question, like, I always vote Democratic because I'm like, you know what's got a better chance to happen poor people.But the one thing I know about poor people, they're always poor. And in a Democratic Party, us, as black people, we voted for them. First of all, actually, black people used to be Republicans until the Civil Rights Act.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That's exactly right.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Back in the day. Most people even know that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That's exactly right. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But we both pretty much been Democratic for the last X amount of years. But we never hold them accountable. And they only come around every four years and say, vote for us.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: They take all our votes for granted. That's why black people are leaving the Democratic Party. That's not me and they're going to the Republican Party. They're becoming disinterested. They're like, I'm not going to vote.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: When Donald Trump says that, you know, black people can relate to them, or he relates to black people because, you know, been falsely accused or arrested, have you ever been arrested?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: A few times.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: A few.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: And you know what? I'm not proud of that fact, because I was wrong.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: For what for?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: For fighting, for fighting. When I was young, I was stupid. I got to fighting a lot. Because instead of walking away like an adult, I was a stupid kid. And you know, and kids -- I tell kids, then, man, walk away.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Let them call you names. Fighting --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But you didn't do that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because I was young and stupid.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And stupid. BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. But if you see somebody, a black person with a Donald Trump --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm going to punch him right in the eye.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You're going to punch him in the face.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Gayle, I promise you.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I would bail you out. I would bail you out.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You're not going to be my first call.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK. That's good. We'll be right back with renowned presidential historian and Biden whisperer, Jon Meacham will join us right after the break.Who is your first call?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's a good question.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: How are you feeling about the 2024 election?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm a bit terrified.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Nervous?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's kind of the difference between democracy and not democracy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Really worried about people who want to legislate against other people living their lives.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I feel so bad for the next generation that we've left a disaster. It's a hot mess. Maybe we need to go back to kindergarten, and we need to learn how to compromise.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: This is the best answer we've ever had on the show.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is. What issues concern you most is you get ready to vote in 2024?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The migrant crisis, especially in this city.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: For me, one of the biggest things is getting back to government.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh, the preservation of democracy.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I think abortion is a big one, women's rights, a lot of things that, you know, what's happening in Israel. There's --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Who's calling us?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm on television. Quit calling me.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: JON MEACHAM, PRESIDENTIAL HISTORIAN
utterances.sentences: Oh, I can do that. I could pull that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Hold that thought. On Abraham Lincoln, Thomas Jefferson, Andrew Jackson, and George H. W. Bush, just to name a few. He's also an informal adviser to President Joe Biden, who will be giving the State of the Union address coming up very soon.Something tells me that you may have a hand in that, Mr. Meacham.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Just a hand. Just a hand. I help -- President Biden's my friend. I help him when I can.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: When you see the public, the people who vote say terrified --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Nervous.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: -- nervous, and things like that, like, you should be excited for an election. But you hear that from the public, what's the first thing going through your mind?

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: This is like 1860, it's that elemental. That was a presidential election where we had to decide what was our -- not just what was our difference about policy, what do we want to pursue about this or that, but what was our common understanding of human identity. It's that fundamental.And what Donald Trump has brought us is this elemental struggle between the rule of the strong versus the rule of law. And for all of our failings -- KING: People keep saying democracy is at stake. We heard that a lot.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: It is. And democracy's not just a form of government, right? It' s a way of seeing each other. If we don't see other as equal, as equal standing in dignity, then we can dominate each other. And the point of the United States, the first nation ever founded fully on an idea, written by a boring white guy like me, Jefferson --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That's how you described yourself.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: But seriously --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Mr. Boring, white, guy. You said that.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: But it was for -- we've been out of compliance with the Declaration of Independence longer than we'd been in compliance with it. But people who look like me are the ones who set the standard. We went out and said, this is the idea we are going to live up to. And we're going to seek to love up it.And if you get into a struggle where if you lose and you just say, well, we going change the rules, or I did it so therefore it's OK, then we not seeing each other as equals anymore. We're seeing each other as reflexive rivals or enemies, and that's the climate that we're in. We don't have to be. We choose to be in this.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Do you think we choose this, Jon? I mean --

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: -- you see, people on both sides are unhappy. People on those sides were unhappy with Joe Biden. People the other side are unhappy with Donald Trump. People say, we don't have really two good candidates to choose from.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That's how most Americans feel.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: It is, but we've been unhappy since the third chapter of Genesis, right, since we got kicked out of the garden.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Have we been this unhappy, though?

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: I think -- well, let's think of it this way. In my world, we have a debate about, were we founded in 1619 or 1776? I think neither. The United States of America, as we understand it today, was founded in 1965. The first integrated electorate in the United States was in 1968.20 minutes ago, historically, the Immigration and Nationality Act that took -- helped change the country, the Civil Rights Act, the Voting Rights Act. We're 55 years old or so. And so, the notion that we were unhappy because of the choices. Sure, I mean, we would all love to have Lincoln running against Kennedy and you're not really going to lose, right? But that's not reality. And reality is this is where we are. The choice is very stark. I personally, I'm not a Democrat, I'm not Republican, I've voted for presidents of both parties. But I honestly believe that there's a patriotic imperative to vote for President Biden against Former President Trump. I really do.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Are you concerned about his age?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But you're also a friend to Joe Biden's too. So, does that make you a little --

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: I am, but I believe this -- so, take it for what it's worth. That's why I said that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Take it for what it was.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK. Go ahead, Charles.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But are you concerned about his age?

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: I'm concerned about my age in particular. No, the older I get.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: No, but I'm not. But I understand that you can't tell half the country that they're just wrong to worry about something. So, he's got to show us and not just tell us. I consider and tell you that I've talked to him and I never had any doubts about his capacity and his thing, but why would you believe me? For the same reason you just said? So, he has got a show us. He can't just stand for re-election, he got run for it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. But there are so many people, Jon, who are concerned about his energy, his vitality.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Are those not legitimate concerns in your opinion?

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: I think -- let me be very clear. Of course, they're legitimate concern.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: So, my concern -- and, well, let me rephrase it. Everybody's concern, if President Biden was to win again, as bad as things were last time, we talked about the insurrection, whatever, and he was saying the election was stolen.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Like, what's going to happen?

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: It's a great worrisome question. And I, by the way, wouldn't be as -- wouldn't have said what I said about the need to put the ideas of the country ahead of any policy disputes, which I said a second ago, if not for the lies about election.In many ways, for all of -- whatever we may disagree about -- with Trump, in many ways, at least he was a recognizable American political character in -- through the 2020 election, an extreme version, but, you know, you sort of knew you could find him on the GPS. You can't -- could not do that when people are storming the Capitol, which, you know, in my business, it's a bad thing. It's against the business model to say something is unprecedented because we're all precedent. That was unprecedented.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What did you make of Mitch McConnell's decision to step down as Senate Majority Leader, that he's going to do it in November --

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: -- remain in the Senate?

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: And Mitch McConnell, agree or disagree, is, I would argue, the most powerful Senate leader in American history, if you think about it. He just changed jurisprudence with the Supreme Court for at least two generations.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Right. He's just an immensely powerful figure. And I do think -- and it's amazing that this is where we are given his essential partisanship, but he was a dealmaker of a kind, right? President Biden could deal with him.And what's happening to the Senate is what has already happened to the House, right, it's just -- it is becoming ever more polarized.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. I just don't think that's hard. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We know you have to catch a plane. We thank you so much. Thank you. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: MEACHAM
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, I mean, they already had this job. Now, these old white dudes got to come back and reclaim it? Like, come on, sir, go do something new. We're so desperate. Like, let someone else run the show.

utterances.speaker: STEWART
utterances.sentences: We're talking about the election, right?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I said what I said.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I know, I like that part.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I love that line. I said what I said. We were so excited to talk to our next guest. The hilarious and talented, as you see there. Daily Show correspondent, we're talking about Dulce Sloan, she's with us. She's also by the way, a standup comedian and now she's the author of a new book, "Hello Friends!", I love this title. "Stories of Dating, Destiny and Day Jobs."Hello Ms. Sloan.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Hello, Ms. Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, what's it like having Jon Stewart back? And do you want that job?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Here's the thing --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Hamana-hamana-hamana.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Listen.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Listen.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Certain people do things very well.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: And certain people can do things and certain people do things very well.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I can do the job.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Jon Stewart's great at the job.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: So, I think especially now with just how wild everything is, I think people do need a voice that they know. Like if we'd have already had a permanent host beforehand, that would have been a huge thing to try to tackle with the selection cycle.But I think we're in the opportunity where we were to have Jon come back in such a -- I mean, he got his second term. We're going to see if Biden's going to get his second term. So, we're going to figure out who's -- which all white man's doing what.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I think is what we're trying to figure out this year.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What a time for Jon to come back. And, you know, I've watched last week, last Monday, and he talked -- I was very touched when he closed with the death of his dog Dipper. And I love that he shared that with the audience because it was such a vulnerable moment for him. Any of us who has had a dog or lost a dog knows that kind of pain. I was very touched by that. What was the reaction at your place when he was doing it?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I am a cat person.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You don't say.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You do know that's not a real pet, right?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Listen, I'm not going to let an old black man talk to me about cats.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: So --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: OK. I'm just telling you. SLOAN

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Do not trust cats.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Listen, what did I say your social security number, Mr. Barkley?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, no. I'm going to tell you.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I can't -- listen, a cat has never sent anybody to jail.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: See. Look at God. Oh, say it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: A dog has never sent anybody to -- what do you mean?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: K9 units, Ms. Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh, oh, oh. See, I've never --

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: TSL.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: -- I've never been arrested. He's been arrested. So, I don't know that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I don't know that part of the line.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I've never been arrested, but I've seen the truck go by.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK. OK. You're right.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: When a drug sniffing dog in the airport.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK. You're right.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Cats don't care how many drugs you bring on a plane.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK. OK. Fair enough.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Dogs are snitches.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: All right. OK. So, being a comedian --

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: -- we're in a very interesting time.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, they're trying to counsel people now. KING

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: How much do you concern yourself with, what like -- because you -- it's a crazy time. You can offend people now.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: The last comedian that got canceled just hosted SNL.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's a good point. Good point.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: So --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But he was out in the wilderness for a while.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: No, he wasn't. He was fine. He was working.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: OK. So, what do you --

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Comics are loving -- listen, the number of comics that were like, yo, I got to get canceled. Because all the same --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You don't worry about getting --

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: -- everybody knows who you are. I'm --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You don't worry about getting canceled?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: No, I'm a black --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I'm a black woman in America. I can say whatever I want to anybody. What you going to do, be mad? All I did was tell the truth. No one's coming for us like that. Also, like -- literally, comics are, like, because if you're not a well-known comic.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: If someone sees something you said and then they post it or something, you get canceled. Now, no -- like, you had maybe 5,000 followers on your social media.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: If somebody writes an article about something you said at a show, you can get 100,000, 200,000 -- you can go viral and have a million followers overnight.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Dulce, if I didn't know better, I would say you're trying to get canceled.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I'm not trying to get canceled. I'm trying to work.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: What I'm saying is, is that canceling doesn't do what it's supposed to do.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Supposed to do. Mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Because every comedian that got canceled is working. Aziz Ansari is working. Louis C.K. is working. They're out on the road doing shows. People -- it's like it doesn't work. At the whole point of canceling somebody was to take their money or the -- you sit down for a year or two and then you get back up again and then you go on the road. Because the whole point of canceling was to stop somebody from abusing their power.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: But all we seem to want to do is cancel people who are rich. There's a night manager at a pet boy who's terrorizing his whole staff and you all ain't worried about him.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: So, that's what you're not doing. We're not trying to come for people who are really abusing their power --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Abusing their power.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: -- and hurting people. People on the internet want to see rich people fall. Because if the goal was to stop somebody from abusing their position, then we would be coming for everybody who was mistreating their employees.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: So, tell us about the book.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, I got tricked.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You got tricked?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I told Ms. Gayle about this. My manager tricked me into writing a book because he called me one day. He was like, what if you write a book? And I was like, that sounds very difficult.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because you didn't think you could write a book, you said.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: I didn't want -- I didn't think I could. I kind of didn't want to because I don't know if you see all the pages in a book, Mr. Charles Barkley, but you got to put words on those.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I love -- Charles, she was saying about dating, because she gives all of the people she's dated names. Like, one was The Mechanic. One was Doll Eyes. One was Baby Shug.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Oh, no don't -- I didn't date doll eyes. That's one of the guys from the show. I don't want to mess up his marriage. KING

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, Baby Shug, The Mechanic, The Dummy.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: The Dummy, Dumb and Dumber, you talked about them.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, Dummy. Yes, he was -- I mean, he had his purposes. Sorry.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But you say --

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Sometimes I have a flashback and stuff like that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But now, despite all -- after all the dating, you say that you don't want a man with -- not potential. What do you say you said you wanted to be potential?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I like this --

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Because I am successful --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: -- using my credits.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: And I just bought a house in L.A. and --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Congrats.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much. And I have --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Is that your first house?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: It is my first house.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Feels very grown up, doesn't it?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: It's crazy.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: You just get somebody's money and they give you keys. It's nuts. I'm like, oh, I own all of this? This is weird. And so, I got -- I bought a house. I bought a car. I take care of my family. My mother's retired. And I retired her. I take care of her. And so, I can't deal with the man who has potential.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: You have to have somebody who's fully potenched (ph), right?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Which means? Which means?

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Which means you got to be able to pay half the bills in this house. And if you can't pay half the bills in this house, then sir, your drawers can't live here. Because then you're just another dependent. I got to feed you, my mama, my brother, the dog. I don't have time. No, that sounds crazy.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I think she's right on that too.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No, I do too.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I told you, John Thompson's always said, he said, you know, this player's got potential. Potential gets you fired.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: See?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, potential gets you fired. But I had this same conversation with my daughter when she started dating. I said, you know the difference between a career and a job, right? She said -- I said, don't bring nobody home that's got no job. Bring somebody home that's got a career.

utterances.speaker: SLOAN
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It was only $40 million?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Stop giving the man that's a --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OK. OK.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Hey.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: $40 million. OK. I stand corrected.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know how much I like you and admire you and respect you because I talk about all the time, you know, my brother didn't make it out the other end of the spectrum. He died at a very young age dealing with addiction issues. And I'm just so proud of you because I think what you're doing is important. You know, we talked about this on -- man Ernie's (ph) podcast. And it was the most response we ever got for a podcast --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: With Rex.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: -- with Rex because he opens up. What made you want to open up in this book?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: You know, I'm glad you brought up your brother. Your brother, we've talked about him before.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: You know, I should acknowledge this first. I feel conflicted sitting here being celebrated for failing spectacularly in life.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: And just know though, my family is so happy I'm healthy and clean. But this book drops a big emotional bomb back in their lives. It's reopening old wounds. My ex -wife, you know, she's the best.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: She's a saint after reading your book.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: She's a saint.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: She raised our kids.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Bridget, yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Bridget. I played with our kids. I love and respect her more than I ever did when we were --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But she did the heavy lifting.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: She did the heavy lifting. So, as I say that, just know, you know, this is on my parents, my sister who basically came to my rescue and saved my life. Got me into rehab. My folks. It's just a tough day. But I felt like this was something that, you know, you go through things and --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But everybody's going through stuff, Rex. You can help so many people because I think -- I learned it from my brother because I've had a bunch of conversations with other people who were having issues. They're like, thank you for sharing, because it is painful.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, because I -- my mom never got over my brother dying.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: She never got over him dying. But, man, what you're doing, going around speaking. Writing this book. Man, you're going to help so many people, because you're not in this by yourself. Like you talk about your family.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: But like there's other people around in New York, everywhere around the country, around the world, they got stuff going on. And here in -- you can make it out the other end and try to use it in a positive way. I admire you, brother.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But Rex, I want to talk about how you opened the book. Because you opened the book at your arrest at the Apple store. You were arrested at stealing stuff from the Apple store where you had gone back repeatedly. It wasn't just one thing. And by stuff, you know, they had a bin of products and stuff, and you would take them, and then you would take them to the pawn shop.You had done that for seven to eight months. And you had somebody who had made $40 million at one point. How did this happen to you? And when we talk about drugs, we should say it was prescriptive drugs. You thought of it as medicine. You said in the book, you didn't really see it as drugs.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, I -- look, I was always an addict. I was a basketball addict first. That was my first love. It was my only love, Chuck, you know how that is.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: You got to work so hard. You don't just get there by accident. And for a lot of people, to become great, you guys, to become great at anything, you got to sacrifice a little bit of sanity. And keep going back the next day. Keep getting your head beat in. So, I had that already built in. I also grew up going to the racetrack with my dad. I'm a huge thorough -- I liked basketball. I love horse racing. BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: And so, sitting down with him, filling out a racing form --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: The forms.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Reading the form, something that we did. Something we also kept from my mom you know. So, there was a little dishonesty going on there, made it kind of, you know, exciting, I guess.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: The thrill of that.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: The thrill of that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Take us to you in the Apple store. You're stealing stuff out of the Apple store, Rex.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, you know --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What are you thinking in this moment?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: You know, we had a chance to talk a little bit beforehand and this takes me to a really hard place. You know, normally in this story, we kind of gloss past that, you know. It happened and then the recovery. No, the Apple store, I'm -- I still -- I get emotional about it because I can't believe it was me. You know, you knew me.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Before those drugs, I would have never, never done something like that. That's what I have to believe because if I don't believe that, then it's just morally I'm a bad guy.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Charles, what did you think when he was arrested? Because it made national news. The video was all over the place.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, I felt --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What did you think when you saw that?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: How did you know that? BARKLEYBecause when you have an addiction, nothing matters. Because I bought my mother and grandmother matching Rolexes. My brother stole them and pawned them. I called the police chief and I said, come get his ass right now. Because -- and I know -- like to piggyback on Rex's point, I know my brother would not have stolen my mom's and grandmother's Rolex unless he was under the influence.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You're not yourself. And that was the hardest thing for me to learn. Like, dude, you can't stop doing this.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because you're not yourself.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: You know, when I was in --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And you write this, Rex. You said, never underestimate the ability of an addict to rationalize destructive behavior. Which sounds like what he said about his brother and what you did that day in the Apple store.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Exactly. And, you know, we've seen videos. This OxyContin and heroin and fentanyl that we have, they're monsters. The OxyContin is a monster. That they would give it to someone for an appendicitis is beyond me, but I was in love within a couple of days. And you know, we've seen these videos on TV before where you see people stopped at stoplights or cars are stopped and they're just sort of out of it from heroin or painkillers or opioids.That's what it's like. You're just in a fog. You can function a little bit. But the genius of it and also the horror of it is that it doesn't smell like weed. You don't smell like alcohol, but you get it -- you get your high and nobody would ever really know it, but every -- a lot of people walking around with pockets full of pills.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: What was the turning point?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: For what?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: For -- what -- you were, like, I got to get my crap together.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: When you said, enough, yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I've had enough.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm letting my family down.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was when I was arrested, you know.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: At the Apple store.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: No, I wasn't arrested at the Apple Store. So, here's another really awful thing that I did.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But they were leading you away in handcuffs.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes. I -- so, the police came to my house, my apartment and -- in Scottsdale, and they knocked on the door and I saw the police were there. And I did just something despicable and asked my son to tell him I wasn't there. I -- to Zeke. You know Zeke.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You asked him to lie.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: And he did it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: He did it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because you're his dad.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: And then he left and went to class. I came out, got in the car, and six cars approached me, and that's where they took me in. And still, I didn't know what was going on. I thought it was a license thing, an issue thing, or an insurance thing that I'd had for years. I couldn't get my license, photo radar in Scottsdale.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: So, finally once I got there, they gave me a phone -- my phone to get a number out of. I didn't know any numbers. And Charles, and my best friend Josh, and so many people are texting saying, we love you. We don't know what's happened. I didn't even know what had happened at that time. Then they take me in and put me in a room. And I've seen enough "Law & Orders" to know that I needed a lawyer.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: A never good guess.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, and then they showed all the video. They've --

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't -- I'd never watched it just until the other day.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You've never watched it?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: I -- yes, KING

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: I just saw a little now.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: It's hard to watch.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know -- man, you're getting me emotional. Because I was, like -- I was texting. You're like, yo man.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: You were.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Hang in there. Because I -- man, I know he's a good dude.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, you said that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I do. I said, yo man, you're a good dude, man. Hang in there. Because, man, I'm telling you something, when you and your family are going through this stuff, like, it's nothing -- like, I would just -- I'm like, yo man, hang in there.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But, man, I -- listen, I'm going to say it over again. I'm so proud of you. And you got to keep using your platform because there's just so many people out there who are struggling. And they need to know that they're not alone because, you know, that's the one thing John Lucas and his group taught me, like, you know, man, there's a lot of people out here on drugs.

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What's your life like today?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: It's -- I'm as good as I've been in, you know -- really, I'm as functioning as an adult as I've ever been in my whole life over the last eight or nine years. I've been --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You don't have urgence to use --

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: No, I don't --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: -- any of those?

utterances.speaker: CHAPMAN
utterances.sentences: No. You know, it was --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: OxyContin like any other --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I'm so glad you're OK. I really, really enjoyed your book.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm glad you're OK. And I love you sharing your story, man. You're going to help a lot of people, brother.
